items.title: Introduction
items.text:
Welcome on my portfolio !

Here you will find the tools I used w/ some of the projects I participated in.

This portfolio's purpose is purely technical, I advise visiting my Linkedin for more informations.

Info

This portfolio is hosted on Vercel .

Explore the sections to get details on my technical skills and see how I can contribute to your projects.

items.title: Projects
items.text:
You are in the projects section.

Here, you will find a selection of the work I got the chance to contribute/create.

They are academical/personal & professionnal.

Most of the projects below are made in groups.

Explore this section to discover how I apply my knowledge to create impactfull and concrete solutions.

items.title: About
items.text:
Cooloc is a website developed to obtain the RNCP “Concepteur Développeur d’Applications” (CDA) certification. Cooloc aims to simplify shared-housing management.

All the project documentation is located in the /backups folder.

I made everything Open Source because that’s what development is all about: sharing

items.title: About
items.text:
Understanding basic cryptographics through this Python project.

I learned how to :

  • Create my own token (Tekra)
  • Create blocks of this token (or transactions with any other tokens/currency)
  • Create block-chains for these blocks
  • Create result files and logs dated
  • Setup properly Sonarqube, Python & Pytest/Tox

  • Docker image

items.title: About
items.text:
Little Open-Source python script to report transit-gateways of aws account(s).

  • List and storage in a python script all of the TGW in a AWS acc.
  • Creates output files in .json and .r format
  • Strong unit testing for the account
  • Assume role tuto (Security ++)
  • Github actions to have a better run sort of report

items.title: Links
items.text: • GitHub

items.title: About
items.text:
This project allowed us to put into practice the fundamentals of DevOps culture: automation, collaboration, and continuous deployment.

Even though the application is simple, most of our work focused on the infrastructure and delivery pipeline.

We used:

  • Docker to isolate services (frontend, backend, database),
  • Ansible to automate deployment on an Azure VM,
  • GitLab CI to manage a complete pipeline (test, build, deploy),
  • And a rigorous use of Git with branches and merge requests.

items.title: About
items.text:
Objective: Build a banking platform

  • Create an account (/register)
  • Log in (/login)
  • View your balance (/dashboard)
  • View cryptocurrency prices (/cryptos)
  • Make transfers between two accounts (/transfer)
  • Perform buy/sell operations (/buy or /transfer)

items.title: Tools
items.text:
Here is the tools section.

You will find here a glimpse of the technos, work environnments and softwares I use.

This section reflects the skills I acquired throughtout my experiences either academical, professionnal or personal. This also indicate my ease with each of them.

items.title: OS
items.text:
Here are the operating systems I use(d) :

  • Windows

    I'm using Windows on a daily basis since I've been using a computer. I'm really familiar with the file structure and the architecture.

    I know the basics of Powershell.

  • Ubuntu/Linux

    I'm using linux commands on a daily basis. I'm familiar with the file structure since I've worked with linux servers (CPAM & CAAS).

    I'm using Ubuntu shell w/ WSL on most of the projects I participate in. I master bases with VIM.

items.title: Programming languages
items.text:
This is the list of the programming languages I use(d) through my projects. I've these projects mostly for back-end developement :

  • Python

    I'm familiar w/ Python since high-school.

    I use Python frequently for most of my projects It's my main stack. I master the concepts wich I applied on these projects Cooloc, BlockChains and TGW Reporting.

    I also used Python for a variety of projects wich you can find here

  • Java

    I'm familiar w/ Java since my 2nd year of post-secondary education.

    I use Java w/ Spring on a daily basis w/ CA-AS.

    I master most of OOP's concepts.

  • JavaScript

    I'm familiar w/ JavaScript since my 1st year of post-secondary education.

    I'm not using JS as much as Python & Java but I still used it for projects front-end projects like : DevOps & BankWerk

  • PHP/Symfony

    I'm familiar w/ PHP since my 2nd year of post-secondary education.

    I was using PHP and Symfony on a daily basis when I was @ CPAM94 wich I worked on AAVA.

    I used PHP for Audiora.

  • Bash

    I'm familiar w/ Bash scripts since my 2nd year of post-secondary education. I'm using bash on a daily basis w/ CA-AS.

items.title: Miscellaneous
items.text:
Here is the diverse tools I'm using daily :

  • Git

    I mastered the concepts and I wrote doc for CA-AS internal formations.

  • Jenkins

    I'm using/fixing Jenkins during my CA-AS internship.

  • GitHub/GitLab

    I'm familiar with both plateform's CI-CD tools wich I use in most of my projects

    I'm using GitHub for most of my personal/academical projects (Cooloc, BlockChain, TGW Reporting, etc...).

    I'm using/used GitLab daily in both my internships (w/ AAVA).

    I also used it for an academical project : DevOps

items.title: Cloud
items.text:
Here is my experiences with the big 3 cloud providers :

  • AWS

    AWS is the cloud provider I used the most.

    I have a cloud practitionner badge and TGW Reporting is based off of AWS.

  • Azure

    Azure is my least favourite cloud provider. I used it on DevOps

  • GCP

    I'm currently learning a lot on GCP since I used it w/ firebase on a lot of my academical projects : Cooloc, Audiora & BankWerk.

    I'm also trying to get the GCP Cloud engineer certification wich will be usefull for my career.

    I'm currently learning a lot on GCP since I used it w/ firebase on a lot of my academical projects : Cooloc, Audiora & BankWerk.

    I'm also trying to get the GCP Cloud engineer certification wich will be usefull for my career.

items.title: SQL/NoSQL
items.text:
Here are the main SGBD I use(d) w/ both SQL & NoSQL :

  • SQL

    I'm really familiar w/ SQL.

    I used mostly PostgreSQL but I know Oracle & MySQL quite well.

    Here are some projects where I used SQL : DevOps, Cooloc, AAVA

  • NoSQL

    I'm also really familiar w/ NoSQL especially MongoDB wich I used during my internships.

    Here is also projects where I used NoSQL : Cooloc, BankWerk & [Audiora](https://mathieuaudibert/projects#audior
